- [X] Refer to [Differences between Windows PowerShell 5.1 and PowerShell](https://docs.microsoft.com/powershell/scripting/whats-new/differences-from-windows-powershell).

### Steps to reproduce

When using the Host's `$host.UI.RawUI.SetBufferContents` method, an exception is thrown when using a Rectangle, but not when using a Coordinate. The exception notes that an overload cannot be found with an argument count of 2, but both overloads for SetBufferContents use 2 arguments. 

From what I've seen, this happens in `5.1`, `7.2.6`, and the newest `7.3.0-preview.8`. It should be noted that this will only apply to Windows, as GetBufferContents is not implemented into the Unix platform.

### Expected behavior

```console
#test message before clearing buffer
PS> $rec=[System.Management.Automation.Host.Rectangle]::new(0,0,0,10)
PS> $buffer=$host.ui.RawUI.GetBufferContents($rec)
PS> Clear-Host
PS> $host.ui.RawUI.SetBufferContents($rec,$buffer)

The exact text "PS>#test m" should be overlaid on the first line in the buffer.
```


### Actual behavior

```console
#test message before clearing buffer
PS> $rec=[System.Management.Automation.Host.Rectangle]::new(0,0,0,10)
PS> $buffer=$host.ui.RawUI.GetBufferContents($rec)
PS> Clear-Host
PS> $host.ui.RawUI.SetBufferContents($rec,$buffer)
MethodException: Cannot find an overload for "SetBufferContents" and the argument count: "2".
```

comments.author: nsstrickland
comments.body:
> Because `$Host.UI.RawUI.GetBufferContents()` is not implemented

`$Host.UI.RawUI.GetBufferContents()` is not implemented on the Unix platform, this will only apply to Windows. I'll amend the description to note that.

comments.author: 237dmitry
comments.body:
It's good that this overload works (on Windows):
```
void SetBufferContents(System.Management.Automation.Host.Coordinates origin, System.Management.Automation.Host.BufferCell[,] contents)
```

```powershell
Clear-Host
Write-Host "aaaaaa`nbbbbbb`ncccccc" -F Green

$rec=[System.Management.Automation.Host.Rectangle]::new(0,0,2,2)
$buffer = $Host.UI.RawUI.GetBufferContents($rec)
$coord = [System.Management.Automation.Host.Coordinates]::new(0,0)

Clear-Host

$Host.UI.RawUI.SetBufferContents($coord, $buffer)
[console]::CursorTop = 5
```

comments.author: nsstrickland
comments.body:
> It's good that this overload works (on Windows)

Yes, that's mentioned in the description and shown in one of the screenshots. The Rectangle overload not working is still unexpected behavior.

comments.author: MartinGC94
comments.body:
It's working as intended. `SetBufferContents` has 2 overloads, one that takes `Coordinates` + `BufferCell[,]` and one that takes `Rectangle` + `BufferCell` you are attempting to call it with a `Rectangle` + `BufferCell[,]` so that obviously won't work.  
If your goal is to save some content, clear the screen and then reapply it then you can do it like this:

```
$UpperLeft        = [System.Management.Automation.Host.Coordinates]::new(0, 0)
$LowerRight       = [System.Management.Automation.Host.Coordinates]::new($Host.UI.RawUI.BufferSize.Width, 0)
$TopLineRectangle = [System.Management.Automation.Host.Rectangle]::new($UpperLeft, $LowerRight)
$TopLineContent   = $Host.UI.RawUI.GetBufferContents($TopLineRectangle)
clear
$Host.UI.RawUI.SetBufferContents($UpperLeft, $TopLineContent)
```
